meanings.definition: A person who is slow-witted or foolish.
meanings.sent1: Tommy is often called a timberheads by his classmates for his forgetfulness.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a timberheads and remember to bring your homework to school.
meanings.sent3: The timberheads in the story always made everyone laugh with their silly mistakes.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a timberheads when she realized she had been waiting at the wrong bus stop.
meanings.sent5: Being a timberheads can sometimes lead to funny situations.

meanings.definition: The topmost part of a tree or wooden post.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel perched on the timberheads of the tall oak tree.
meanings.sent2: The timberheads of the fence were weathered from years of exposure to the elements.
meanings.sent3: The cat climbed to the timberheads of the tree and refused to come down.
meanings.sent4: The flag fluttered proudly from the timberheads of the ship's mast.
meanings.sent5: The timberheads of the pine tree swayed gently in the breeze.

meanings.definition: A wooden beam or plank used in construction.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter carried the heavy timberheads to the building site.
meanings.sent2: The old barn needed new timberheads to support its roof.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids used the timberheads as balance beams in their play.
meanings.sent4: The sound of hammers echoed as the workers nailed the timberheads into place.
meanings.sent5: The timberheads creaked under the weight of the structure being built.
